page.title: 01Farmland -St Owens Cross
page.content: A very rural area. It is fairly flat open and rolling farmland. It comprises of cultivated fields, for cereal growing,and grassland for sheep grazing. About half of the cultivated is for horticultural crops, e.g. strawberreis, raspberries, gooseberries, sprouts and also orcharding for apples, pears and cherries. The population is small and scattered. The housing is mainly farms ad cottages. The two main areas for houses being hamlets, at St Owens Cross and Glewstone. The majority of work is to be found away from the area, except where it is farm labour.
